resources.string: FooDish is a Filipino food recipe application that provide users with a wide range of recipes typically for breakfast,lunch, and dinner meals. A list of recipes and food-related images make up the application that aims to simplify and help user enhance their cooking experience by providing a diverse array of recipe along with helpful features to help improve their cooking skills.
Menard James Sayson\nBachelor of Information and Technology Programming\nsmenardjames@gmail.com
Mharvin Caramat\nBachelor of Information and Technology Programming\ncaramatmharvin@gmail.com
Aljon Gutierrez\nBachelor of Information and Technology Programming\naljongutierrez08@gmail.com
Julius Adrian Ramos\nBachelor of Information and Technology Programming\njuliuscervantesramos@gmail.com
John Alexander Vargas\nBachelor of Information and Technology Programming\njobe.vargas.up@phinmaed.com

• 3 pounds pork shoulder, cut into 2-inch cubes 
 • 1 onion, peeled and sliced thinly 
 • 1 head garlic, peeled and minced 
 • ½ teaspoon peppercorns 
 • 2 bay leaves 
 • 1 cup water 
 • ½ cup vinegar 
 • ¼ cup soy sauce 
 • 1 tablespoon canola oil 
 • 1 cup coconut milk 
 • 2 Thai chili peppers, stemmed and chopped 
 • Salt to taste

1. In a pot over medium heat, combine pork, onions, garlic, peppercorns, bay leaves, water, vinegar and soy sauce. Bring to a boil for about 5 minutes, skimming scum that floats on top. 
 2. Lower heat, cover and simmer for about 30 to 40 minutes or until meat is tender. Drain meat. Reserve the aromatics and 1 cup of the liquid. 
 3. In a wide pan over medium heat, heat oil. Add meat and aromatics and cook, stirring occasionally, until lightly browned. 
 4. Add reserved liquid, coconut milk, and chili peppers. 
 5. Lower heat, cover and continue to cook for about 15 to 20 minutes or until meat is completely cooked and sauce is reduced and thickened. 
 6. Season with salt to taste. Serve hot. 
 
 Reference: https://www.kawalingpinoy.com/adobo-sa-gata/
